chapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Post-Mortem Report
evidences.description1: Time of death just after 2 p.m. Death is believed to be due to trauma to the victim's lung from a knife blade. Only a single wound was identified.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the scene taken by police just after the incident occurred. The stab wound in the victim's back is clearly visible.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Soseki Natsume Article
evidences.description1: A newspaper containing an article about a discussion between my father and Soseki-san. The debate became quite spirited.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Fountain Pen
evidences.description1: The pen that the victim was found grasping in her hand. It carries the initials 'R.M.'.
evidences.description2: The fountain pen that the victim was found grasping in her hand. It carries the initials 'R.M.' as well as an emblem of some description.
evidences.description3: A fountain pen bearing the initials 'R.M.' and an emblem of some description. There is a very small amount of liquid still inside the ink reservoir.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Poison Article
evidences.description1: An article about poison that was stolen from a laboratory at Yumei University. Even my father, who is responsible for the lab, knew nothing of the incident.
evidences.description2: An article about poison that was stolen from a laboratory at Yumei University. The reporter, Menimemo-san, based it on information he gleaned by eavesdropping.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Incriminating Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print taken at the moment the victim was attacked. My friend Rei can be seen kneeling over Miss Brett.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Chemical Reagent
evidences.description1: A special indicator solution for a new poison under development by my father's team. It's been created in strict secrecy and exists only in my father's laboratory.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Murder Weapon
evidences.description1: A small knife from the scene of the crime that was found in the victim's back. No trace of poison was found on the blade.

evidences.currentChapter: The Adventure of the Blossoming Attorney
evidences.name: Beach Hut Plan
evidences.description1: A plan of the layout of the small beach hut where the victim was found.

chapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Secondhand Book Receipt
evidences.description1: A receipt for some books that Mr Natsume purchased at a secondhand bookshop. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Nearby Street Map
evidences.description1: A street map of the neighbourhood where Mr Natsume has his lodgings. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Pair of Teacups
evidences.description1: The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. The one with the green line around the rim was Mr Natsume's.
evidences.description2: The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. There is no tea ring on the inside of Mr Natsume's cup.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Torn-Off End of Envelope
evidences.description1: A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. The rest of the envelope could not be located.
evidences.description2: A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It fits perfectly with an envelope in Miss Green's possession.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Bar of Soap
evidences.description1: A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. It's one of two that were found there.
evidences.description2: A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. There is a two centimetre diameter circular depression in the middle of one surface.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Crime Scene Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the scene taken by police upon their arrival. The victim can be seen unconscious at the table, having been poisoned.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Victim's Medical Report
evidences.description1: A report issued by Scotland Yard's medical officer. It obviously mentions the poison as well as other details gleaned during the police investigation.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Gas Meter
evidences.description1: A meter that dispenses gas for a set time after a coin is inserted. It sports a very strong lock, especially with Mr Shamspeare in mind.
evidences.description2: A meter that dispenses gas for a set time after a coin is inserted. The attached coin box sports a very strong lock, and there is a tiny hole in its base.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Handprints on the Wall
evidences.description1: Traces of handprints on the wall, discovered using the Skin Print Seeker gun. There are multiple prints on either side of a hanging picture.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Capital Offender Article
evidences.description1: A newspaper article about Selden, a criminal sentenced to receive the death penalty. However, he died of illness in prison whilst his loot remained undiscovered.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Hidden Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It shows the landlord, Mr Garrideb, together with a young man.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Bottle of Poison
evidences.description1: A bottle found in the possession of Miss Green with traces of the slow-acting poison strychnine inside.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Capital Offender's File
evidences.description1: Scotland Yard's file about the convicted criminal Selden that includes the newspaper article about him dying of illness in prison.

evidences.currentChapter: The Memoirs of the Clouded Kokoro
evidences.name: Miss Green's Card
evidences.description1: A note in an envelope that seems to have been ripped open rather roughly. It contains instructions to meet with someone who claims to have information about Duncan Ross.
evidences.description2: A note in an envelope that seems to have been ripped open rather roughly. The envelope fits perfectly with a torn-off piece found at the scene of the crime.

chapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
evidences.description1: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Experiment Sketch
evidences.description1: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Mysterious Contraption â†’ Crossbow
evidences.description1: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately.
evidences.description2: A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow.
evidences.description3: A crossbow found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It belongs to Mr Enoch Drebber.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Piece of Green Cloth
evidences.description1: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Photograph of the Victim
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Screwdriver
evidences.description1: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound.
evidences.description2: A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Photograph of the Balloon
evidences.description1: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Drebber's Card
evidences.description1: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address.
evidences.description2: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
evidences.description1: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower.
evidences.description2: The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Photograph of Drebber
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Camera
evidences.description1: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.
evidences.description2: The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing.
evidences.description3: The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. When the lens is extended, dark staining can be seen on the bellows.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Piece of Broken Glass
evidences.description1: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Science Trophy
evidences.description1: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Waxwork Head
evidences.description1: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Killer's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Post-Explosion Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Drebber's Contract
evidences.description1: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.

evidences.currentChapter: The Return of the Great Departed Soul
evidences.name: Ten-Year-Old Article
evidences.description1: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.

chapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Armband
evidences.description1: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Red-Headed League Article
evidences.description1: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
evidences.description1: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Letter of Introduction
evidences.description1: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us.
evidences.description2: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Dismissal Notice
evidences.description1: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Red Hairpiece
evidences.description1: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Candelabrum
evidences.description1: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Revolver
evidences.description1: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Policeman Figurine
evidences.description1: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street.
evidences.description2: A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Framed Photograph
evidences.description1: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Gregson's Photograph
evidences.description1: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory.
evidences.description2: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range.
evidences.description2: The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
evidences.description1: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Noticeboard
evidences.description1: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey.
evidences.description2: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Venus Firecracker
evidences.description1: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...?
evidences.description2: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Photograph of the Victim
evidences.description1: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
evidences.description1: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked.
evidences.description2: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Inspector's Identification
evidences.description1: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi.
evidences.description2: Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Commemorative Photograph
evidences.description1: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: The Asogi Papers
evidences.description1: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'.
evidences.description2: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Gregson's Trunk
evidences.description1: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Passport
evidences.description1: A passport document that was in Inspector Gregson's possession. It was issued for travel to France the day before his body was discovered.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Klint's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The autopsy report of the final victim of the infamous Professor. The report was authored by Dr John H. Wilson.
evidences.description2: The report from the autopsy of the Professor's final victim. It's signed by Dr John H. Wilson who carried out the procedure, though Professor Mikotoba actually penned the report.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Iris's Lucky Charm
evidences.description1: A little doll of Mr Sholmes in hare form. I've been told to tug its ears if I run out of options in the trial today...

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Great Sword 'Karuma'
evidences.description1: The illustrious blade passed down through generations of the Asogi clan. The prized sword's tip has a small piece missing.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Evacuation Drill Itinerary
evidences.description1: A notice about a practice evacuation to be carried out by the crew of the SS Grouse the night before the ship arrived in Dover. It was found in Judge Jigoku's cabin.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Small Component
evidences.description1: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse.
evidences.description2: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. It's now clear that it's the missing 'crown' of Inspector Gregson's pocket watch. * (This update to the description is entirely optional, and can only be achieved by examining anywhere on this evidence, then the tip on Gregson's Pocket Watch before the former evidence is specifically presented in court. However, this method still occurs in Story Mode.)

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Telegram from Japan
evidences.description1: A telegram from Inspector Hosonaga in Japan with details of the telegram he managed to locate by stealing into Judge Jigoku's office.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Mr Asogi's Ring
evidences.description1: A ring belonging to Genshin Asogi found in Lord Klint van Zieks's stomach during the autopsy. The claws clasping the gem look sharp enough to cause a very nasty scratch.

evidences.currentChapter: Twisted Karma and His Last Bow
evidences.name: Klint van Zieks's Will
evidences.description1: The last will and testament of Lord Klint van Zieks that has been hidden inside the great sword Karuma for years. A trump card left behind by Genshin Asogi.
